Description: Square fragment of textile woven in bleached linen (or cotton); two simple selvedge, and therefore the original width of the cloth, are preserved; one end is decorated with two parallel inwoven blue bands; accross middle is a band bearing geometric motifs and stylised vegetal interlacing embroidered in dark blue, red, brown and black wool; the whole surface of the textiles has been waxed to give it a shiny aspect; between embroidery and blue bands, a Christian cross and possible inscription made with wax, oil or ink (?). Warp: linen (or cotton ?), bleached and waxed, Z, 18/cm Weft: linen (or cotton ?), bleached and waxed, Z, 18/cm
Acquisition name: Donated by: Maj William Joseph Myers (executors of)
